verbose_text: Goitrin (5-vinyl-2-oxazolidinethione), which derives from progoitrin in most brassicas, inhibits the incorporation of iodine into thyroxine precursors and interferes with its secretion and can therefore induce the development of goitre.
evidence: Goitrin (5-vinyl-2-oxazolidinethione), which derives from progoitrin in most brassicas, inhibits the incorporation of iodine
